repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Public Sector Modernization
            Technical Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is assessed as
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. The overall
            performances of the Bank and the Borrower are considered
            satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from this project
            include the following: 1) The project effectively reflected
            the Borrower's own priorities, which was key in
            ensuring the continuous support of the Government, even in
            the face of great challenges such as the devastation brought
            by Hurricane Mitch. 2) The use of multiple instruments,
            --lending and non-lending--, to support Bank intervention
            maximized the Bank's effectiveness. Exhaustive sector
            work provided a thorough diagnosis of the key challenges
            facing the public sector. Similarly, having a PPF
            facilitated project preparation and contributed greatly to
            the project's quality at entry. 3) There are important
            complementarities between structural adjustment and
            technical assistance operations. The effectiveness of the
            Private Sector modernization Structural Adjustment Credit
            (PSMSAC) was greatly enhanced by having a companion
            technical assistance loan, which focused on laying the
            groundwork for the policy actions pursued under the PSMSAC.
            Conversely, those sub-components not included in the
            adjustment operation received significantly less attention
            from the Government, stressing the importance of incentives
            offered by structural adjustment operations. Given the
            complexity of the project, it may have been better to
            include only subcomponents directly related to the PSMTAC.

18155779.trustfund:
TF034543-LATIN AMERICA,- PUBLIC SECTOR
            MODERNIZATION (HONDURAS, VENEZUELA ),TF032879-HONDURAS - PUBLIC SECTOR MODERNIZATION,TF031117-HONDURAS - PUBLIC SECTOR MODERNIZATION

repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Public Sector Modernization
            Technical Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Public Sector
            Modernization Technical Assistance Credit Project are to
            provide: 1) policy formulation support that the government
            needs to design reforms under its public sector
            modernization program (PSMP); 2) implementation support to
            develop the means and information necessary for the reform
            process and to comply with the conditions and action plans
            under the public sector modernization structural adjustment
            credit (PSMSAC), and to modernize human resource management,
            financial management and public procurement systems; and 3)
            institutional strengthening support to the entities that
            will be beneficiaries of these management systems. The
            components of the project are the following: 1) private
            sector participation in public services; 2) administrative
            reform which encompasses institutional restructuring and the
            Honduran Social Security Institute and the Social Security
            System; 3) human resource management; 4) integrated
            financial management and investment programming; and 5)
            public procurement.
